37765190.review: Blazing Beaks is a great buy if you can play with friends due to the multiple multiplayer and coop modes. If you are buying it, like me, for just the story mode, single player, then it squeaks buy as a good deal. (Video Version of this Review.) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mBk8_povBpA&t=25s  Not that there is anything necessarily wrong with this title, but it has a very been there, done that feel to it. I liked the relic system, where you pick up a relic that causes some negative effect till you find an in game shop and can trade it in for something good. This offers a difficult choice of picking up the items and dealing with the negative effect for a later payoff. I also liked the first boss and found him to be a challenge. The randomly generated levels have a lot of traps, and the monsters also leave a varity of damaging effects too. This makes attention to your surroundings and placement key to survival. The weapons in the shop seem a tad expensive as money drops are on the rare side early on. One thing I didn't like was the characters you can choose from, as I found a lot of them to simply be ineffective choices. One character for instance drops a bomb whenever hit, but with such fragile characters this makes no tactical sense. Overall the game is well done with good art and fun rogue-lite twin-stick shooting.

37700243.review: все круто но сделайте нормальное упровление на клавиатуре и мыше

37674838.review:
Здароу, я тут решил написать обзорчик на Blazing Beaks.
Кароче, для тех кому не интересны подробности скажу, что для любителей рогаликов - игра хорошая.

 Игрушка Blazing Beaks, от разроботчиков Applava, достаточно хороша. 
Есть два режима игры : Story (1-4 людьми) и Tournament (2-4 людьми).
В Story ты проходишь уровни и стараешься выжить.
В Tournament нужно соревноваться с друзьями, что бы определить кто из вас настоящий убийца животных. Так же он имеет в себе 4 мода : Deathmatch, One gun, Drop Hearts, Skull keeper, Hunting. Описывать я их не буду т.к. не тестировал.
 Игра сыровата, поэтому не без косяков. Например баланс в игре немного плохой. Во второй локации мобы намного сильнее чем из 1 локации. Красные быки почти не имеют кд. Персонажи очень похожи друг на друга. Нормальный из них только утконос. Ну в общем из минусов всё.
 В игре большое кол-во оружий. От пистолета до пушки стреляющей кислотой и т.д.
Можно насобирать дофига предметов, дающих дебаффы, и обменять их в магазине на крутые предметы, такие как хождение по кислоте без дамага, +20% урона, +20% дальности стрельбы и т.д.

 Игрушка стоит 250 рубасов. Это хорошая цена для отличной игры. Всем советую

10 взрывных яиц из 10

36676262.review: Игра просто отличная, даже для раннего доступа. Интересная идея, высокая сложность, отличная (и главное, милая :3) графика и саундтрек создают уютную атмосферу. Так же, здесь присутствует особая механика, по типу "чем сложнее ты делаешь себе игру - тем проще потом становится". 10 милых утконосиков из 10.

36583255.review: Very fun and challengeing, could do with a slight tutorial, especially the artifacts. Not fussed with the multiplayer content but the single player is very good and I hope to see what the future has in store for this game (more content please).

36580411.review:
Это определенно один из лучших представителей Rogue-like. Но игра сыровата. Стоило бы поработеть над балансом. Некоторые мобы второй локации не имеют кд. Надеюсь разрабы не забьют на игру болтец и добавят разных фишек. Тема с дебаф предметами сделана очень интересно (похвальное новаторство со стороны разрабов) и лично я такого нигде не видел. За час увидел лишь двух боссов. Сделаны боссы приятно. Если фишки и боссы меня порадовали то персы меня разочерови. Из персов действительно хорошим и приятным в игре был только утканос а вот остольный в общем не интересны. Приведу в пример всем рогулюбам известный Исак, там проктически все персы друг от друга отличаются и у всех них разные фишки, а вот в Blazing Beaks  все персы почти идентичны. За исключение маленьких различей и спрайта ничем они не различаются. Но я товар советую ведь 250 шейкелей за это чудо отдать совсем не жаль. Особенно он понравится фанам торона(как по мне игры очень похожи)
Ставлю этому продукту 8 личинок Жабогусиницы из 10 тронов
Почему восемь? Мне не очень понравился баланс некоторых мобов

36537060.review:
Well, i do realise this is an early access and i have seen a lot of different games, but this one is more like an early access of early access, if you know what i mean... Right now there is nearly zero content to play with. We have beautiful graphics, adorable heroes (ducks, pigeons, hens, etc) and very satisfying music. As for game itself you gonna see everything it has in about five minutes of time. But lets start from the beginning and go trough its layers slowly one by one...

[b]Story and other things not present[/b]
So, first of all there is no such thing as 'story'. You just start randomly generated arena and try to survive till every enemy dies. Then you continue to the next level and repeat that till you finish boss and move on to the next zone. Monsters, bosses, enviroment and heroes themself represent no story nor some lore. There is not much to discover, besides few weapons and items. Every arena level is unique and you will not find two of the same, yet, you will face the same enemies every time, same traps and same winning strategies. There is no progression between runs: no unlockable heroes or items, no hero leveling, no upgrades to buy, no quests and no missions, To be honest, i dont think any of it will eventually appear (and even if it will — there is no place for such mechanics to begin with).

[b]Replayability[/b]
I thinks thats the most important part everyone wants to know about before buying a game, especially roguelike one. Blazing Beaks does have some replayability, but after a hour you will be already out of new things to do or discover. The difficulty is quite high, most monsters and traps will instantly kill you even if you got extra lifes in stock. That pretty much ruins any benefits from good half of items and also makes 'hearts system' useless. Right now you start with 1-3 hearts (depends on your hero), but those dosnt really matter when you die from single hit. When you die, you want some revenge and start over again. After 90 minutes that interest is nearly gone. Mostly because our next topic — variety.

[b]Variety and overall content[/b]
Right now we have like 5 monsters in world one, a single boss and a single trap (spikes). All of that has high chance to be spawned in every arena of first world. To be honest, thats not the ammount of content i expected from a game (even in early access). When you lose you have to start over and face same enemies again and the same annoying boss. You cant skip him, you cant kill him fast. Beating first world takes 3 to 5 minutes. Since there is only 3 worlds you can beat game in 15 minutes. Roguelike title is something that brings us different encounters every time, different rules and different builds. Well, not in Blazing Beaks.

[b]Gameplay[/b]
So, you are some duck with a gun and your job is to kill enemies. Sometimes they drop coins which you can use to buy a gun. If your lucky, you get a gun for 5-8 coins, but if you dont it will cost 12-18 (exact same gun). Sometimes there is not enaught cash to buy anything at all and you have to beat world 1 with weak starting weapon. Game relies on RNG a lot. If you cant get money, you will probably lose. To get $ you have to kill enemies fast, cus if you dont — coins will not drop. Moreover, coins will dissapear after short time if you'r not fast to collect them. Some nemies spit posion or deploy mines, so you cant just get closer to get a coin. In this case its better to restart run. Alternativly there are keys and you can use them to get into treasure room. There are bunches of gold inside. But sometimes you get no keys at all as well, yeah.

The main purpose of run is to get 5-8 coins in world one before shop, then you buy a gun and win game with it. There is no point to buy another gun and there is no other things to spend coins on. You cant buy passive items or life. For now i have seen only 4 gun types: laser for killing bunches of monsters, strong shotgun with short range, dual plasma pistol and starting weapon. Every time i visit the shop there is the same guns for selling, sometimes they sell one gun for different prices. In coop mode you can revive second player for 1 life of your own. Playing together makes boss much harder to the extent where you start hating coop mode.

[b]Is there something unique?[/b]
Yes! Instead of useful items your enemies drop bad debuff items which you can collect (only if you want). They can reduce your damage, reload speed, take away rolling ability or cut your coins drop... There are many ways to make you suffer. Why would you collect them? Because thats the only way to get strong positive buff items from shopkeeper who wants to exchange bad artifacts for good. The problem is, you will have to beat few arenas wearing those negative stuff until you reach shop. Sometimes you can even die because of it. And sometimes you are forced to fight boss while its weakening you. I like that system a lot.

[b]Things that you might find annoying[/b]
- Your hero will stop sliding upon hitting wall or decoration, which will probably lead to death;
- Sometimes you dont know what gun you are buying from shop;
- Sometimes its hard to tell whats going on on the screen and you die unexpectedly;
- Gamepad controlls are not good, they make aiming very hard and movement inaccurate;
- There is no descreption or list of items you already wearing (interface need some improvements);
- No bestiary, leaderboard or online multiplayer;
- Sometimes breaking vines is better way to get loot compared to killing enemies and its very anoying.

[b]Should you buy it?[/b]
I think yes. Despite all the negative feedback i gave it, Blazing Beaks is a polished and entertaining game. It sounds and looks wonderful, its funny and user friendly despite high difficulty. For some reason i do want to continue playing it. And also unlike Binding of Isaac and Has-Been Heroes you dont need to spend 60-90 minutes on a single run, instead you need just 15, which is great. Game has no lags and no crucial bugs. If you have 1-3 friends you will get much more fun (but boss needs to be nerfed a bit).
36537060.developer_response:
Hi LotusBlade,

Thank you for your honest opinion. We really appreciate it! We have some questions and clarifications to make.

* “Right now there is nearly zero content to play with.” - What were your expectations and in your opinion, how could this be improved? 

* Story - it’s not a question but just a clarification. In Blazing Beaks we try to reveal a storey without telling it. Every enemy, every secret room, even the menu have some little piece of story element. It’s an Early Access and not all content is present so the name “Story” might be misleading.

* Variety -  “5 monsters in world one, a single boss and a single trap (spikes).”…”To be honest, thats not the ammount of content i expected from a game (even in early access).” - What were your expectations? How many items you think you found during gameplay (rough number)? 

* “Sometimes you dont know what gun you are buying from shop;” - Do you mean random gun or you see the icon but don’t know what the gun does?

* “Gamepad controlls are not good, they make aiming very hard and movement inaccurate;” - What gamepad do you use?

* “There is no descreption or list of items you already wearing (interface need some improvements);” - It will be showed when you pause a game. This is already in our to do list.

We hope that we do not bother you a lot with these questions. Thank you for your answers in advance!
